channel.title: Posts on Fur Trade Days
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Fur Trade Days

item.title: Mac's Carnival
item.description: Building on the great experience attendees had last year, Fur Trade Days is excited to welcome back Mac’s Carnival for 2020!

item.title: Entertainment!
item.description: Lincoln’s Lazerwolfe is planned to take the stage Friday night, while Dylan Bloom is slated for Saturday night.

item.title: Traders' Market
item.description: The Chadron Fur Trade Days Traders’ Market features merchants from around the area and across the country, and provides something for everyone. The 44th annual attraction is planned to remain at the crowd-favorite Dawes County Courthouse Lawn and boasts a slate of new merchants as well as familiar favorites!

item.title: Lions Club FTD Parade
item.description: The 44th Annual Lions Club Fur Trade Days Parade starts at 10 a.m. on Saturday, July 11 and proceeds down Main Street from Tenth to First streets. Candy and other goodies will be passed out along the parade route. Come early to claim a good seat and enjoy the excitement!

item.title: Activities and More
item.description: The String Beans play a kid-friendly show Friday evening at the courthouse lawn. Saturday, mini golf starts off all-ages, then moves to night play in the 200 block of Main St.

item.title: Buckskinner's Camp
item.description: The Bordeaux Creek Fur Trade and Muzzleloading Associationâ€™s Rendezvous, located 3.5 miles east and 8 miles south of Chadron, is expected to open Thursday, July 9, for camp setup.
